The primary aim is to explore a better response when handling VUI's failures - validating user's intention, interventing user's command, and personalizing user's input. In this research, where users engage with virtual assistants for tasks such as setting reminders or perform a simple request, an in-depth survey will be given out to gather feedback and opinion on difference responses being proposed. Recognizing that VUIs can be challenging and exclusive experience for some users; the research aims to establish guidelines for creating intuitive, responsive, and accessible VUIs.
keywords: Voice User Interface, Interfaces, User Experience, Error Handling, Voice Assistant, User Experience

project_title: PROTIC Glove: Haptic and Proximity Glove
description: Commercially produced prosthetics offer limited to no sensory feedback to upper limb amputees. The functional gap between the natural hand and prosthetics remains greater than the ability to mirror the function of healthy limbs, suffering high rejection rates due to lack of sensory feedback, and high reliability on visual/auditory cues for task performance. The PROTIC glove aims to reduce mental overload on everyday tasks, while increasing users’ sense of self embodiment.
keywords: Wearables, Haptics, Haptic Technologies, Prosthetics

info: It's a physical computing/AI interaction with installation art components: I'll be presenting an interactive animatronic robot and I need a large space that I can project visuals onto the walls, control the lights, and play ambient sounds, like some of the studio rooms on the 2nd floor.
description: With the advent of ChatGPT, the mass proliferation of AI is inevitable now more than ever. As futurists race to bring AI out of the virtual and into the real world, humans are approaching an era of cohabitation with machine life. I invite you to speculate on that future with me by spending an afternoon hanging out with your coworker Howard, a slightly-flawed robot companion who had to find work tending to more advanced, useful AI.
keywords: AI, physical computing, animatronics, installations, anti-design, interaction design, installation design

info: installation piece involivng projection on piece + walls + audio
keywords: projection, installation, experiential design, set design, world building, spectacle

info: The pre-production phase of an animated short film that includes sketches, scripts, drafts, and 3D assets.
description:
*Through My Eyes Only* is a doomed horror story that follows Rowan, an aspiring photographer who is quickly losing her vision, and within months, is expected to go blind. Leading up to her impending blindness, she continues to take photographs in a last ditch effort to hold onto her identity as an artist. In a Faustian Bargain for eyesight, Rowan wrestles with her own humanity and morality, who she is as an artist, and how much she values control over her body and mind.

I dreamed up this grotesque story from a real, somewhat illogical fear of my own: going blind and being forced away from my artistic practice. Being a multimedia artist, creation is a part of my everyday life and identity as a person. Throughout the story, I try to emphasize the feelings of lostness, confusion, fear, and helplessness that would come with an integral part of one’s own identity being threatened. Because the film is of the horror genre, I want to focus on isolation and surveillance through visual and non-verbal cues. For example, Rowan does not speak to any other humans throughout the duration of the film. She is alone in every environment: enveloped by the city, her apartment, the red-lit dark room, and the faceless crowds.

Inspired by the stylized works of artists like Albert Mielgo and Miguel Ortega and films like SpiderMan: Into the Spiderverse, I want to use the medium of 3D to create a horror film that feels like it’s own little world: a little world designed to unsettle you. 

To start this project, I developed a stylized script from a short story, including photos and short fiction prose. From there, I sketched the two primary characters that I would be modeling later, wanting to emphasize the asymmetrical and abnormal art style of Rowan and the demon character, making the latter an uncanny version of our protagonist. From there, I worked in Autodesk Maya and ZBrush for the first time to create some 3D assets while sketching the storyboards to reflect the action of the script. Finally, I designed 3 film posters: a main, teaser, and character poster to advertise the film. Presented at the showcase is a pre-production process book, the final draft of the script, character and environment sketches, storyboards of the film, and 3 themed film posters.
keywords: Short Film, 3D, 3D Film, Pre-Production, Horror, Thriller, Photography, Artistic Identity, Morality, Oedipus, Faust, Grotesque, Body Horror, Unreal Engine, ZBrush, AutoDesk Maya.

description: Based on my family's bakery, this project aims to blend culinary heritage with a modern twist for a new restaurant identity. The project's essence lies in crafting a distinctive brand identity encompassing both the digital and physical realms. The journey involves creating a brand kit that extends beyond screens into the tangible world. This project reflects a personal and professional evolution, transforming a family legacy into a vibrant culinary haven that harmonizes tradition and innovation.
keywords: Graphic Design, Social Media, Web Design

project_title: LinguaLore: Understanding How Generative AI Can Aid in Language Learning
description: Inspired by my grandmother's consistent chiding to learn Spanish, I set out to understand if emerging generative AI technology could make learning a language easier and more efficient. The output is research on what AI technologies exist today for language acquisition, how these technologies fare against other methods of language acquisition, and an experimental game prototype based on what was learned from the research.
keywords: Generative AI, Language Learning, UX Research, UX Design, Game Design, Learning Design

project_title: Echoes of Being: A Journey Through Life's Symphony
description: This is a series of short films about my everyday life I recorded throughout my semester. Thinking about how monotonous everyday life can be for each of us, I wanted to find the beauty in these seemingly mundane moments. I wanted to create these short films to capture and share these moments. Each short film reflects my own lived reality. Ultimately, my goal is not to provide answers or explanations, but rather to evoke emotions and spark contemplation. Through my short films, I aim to capture the essence of what it means to be alive—to celebrate the beauty of the everyday and find solace in the shared moments that unite us all.
keywords: Video Production, Music Production

description:
The Mental journey of an Eastern Asian child who experienced family violence in the past.
He overcomes his inner demons, and finally gets rid of all the darkness.
He finds his own way out.
keywords: Experimental Film, Live2D, Special Effects

project_title: Exploration of Cognitive Wellness through Virtual Reality with Spatial Audio
description: This work is an exploration of the intersection between sound and emotion, inviting viewers to immerse themselves in an auditory journey of introspection and discovery. Drawing from my personal experiences and observations of the world around me, I seek to evoke a range of feelings and sensations through carefully crafted sonic landscapes. Viewers will encounter a rich tapestry of sounds, textures, and rhythms, inviting them to reflect on the complexities of human experience and the power of sound to evoke memories and emotions. In the larger context of contemporary art, my work contributes to the ongoing dialogue surrounding the immersive potential of sound as an artistic medium, offering a unique perspective on the intersection of art, technology, and human perception.
keywords: Virtual Reality, Spatial Audio, Cognitive Training
